This website was created by Javed Ali, a Graduate Research Assistant at the University of Central Florida. This research work has been done in collaboration with [Dr. Thomas Wahl](https://core-lab.weebly.com/), [Dr. Alejandra Enriquez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alejandra-rodr%C3%ADguez-enr%C3%ADquez-426b3263/), and [Dr. Md. Mamunur Rashid](https://mmrashid.weebly.com/). This website is a part of the National Academy of Sciences funded project “[The New First Line of Defense: Building Community Resilience through Residential Risk Disclosure](https://hazardaware.org/)” deliverable.

Javed is a Water Resources Engineer and Graduate Research Assistant in the [Coastal Risks and Engineering Lab](https://core-lab.weebly.com/) at University of Central Florida (UCF). His work involves multi-hazards risk assessment and analyzing compound climate/weather extreme events and their spatio-temporal interactions and socioeconomic impacts using machine learning and statistical methods.
